page.title: 16A CAMEO OF SIDLEY VILLAGE
page.content: This was a{farming hamlet}until about 100 yrs ago. It contained two old inns, a forge and a wheelwrights. The latter two are no more. Now there is a{modern shopping centre}with about sixty premises, around a third of them selling food and drink. There is only {one supermarket}however, and although one can buy most daily needs in {Sidley,}none interviewed claimed to do all their shopping there. There is a{market}held one day a week which sells things cheaper than the shops can, but which encourages {more trade}generally on a{Monday.}Some shops keep changing hands and there were three empty in July '85. There is no Chamber of Commerce now.{Sidley}is the area of{youngest population}and most{council housing.}It also has a dismantled{railway}line, axed during the{Beeching cuts}of 1964.
